column4: If you got envy off the web and not envyng from our repos, that was the start of your problems
no, did a sudo apt-get install envyng-core
Very often that is due to unsupported hardware/monitor that does not identify correctly.  Verify your monitor config particularly the v/h rates
Alright.  *doing the pastebin atm, so don't mind me*
sudo apt-get install pastebinit  && cat /etc/X11/xorg.conf | pastebinit (Provide Pastebin link in channel)
I'm not physically on the machine atm, as I keep restarting X to see if the changes help
nVidia Quattro, can't remember if a 460 or 560

Would you mind trying this..  System... Admin... Scrteens and Graphics... click model...then scroll up to either CRT or LCD ... and set the screen... CLICK LCD OR CRT don't worry about finding 'your' screen...  ignore the manufacture part.. just the model part is what you want... so you probably want Generic LCD 1440x900
Look around, I am on a gutsy box atm
Under system/admin I have authorizations, nvidia x server settings, software sources, snaptic package manager, system log and system monitor
under preferences I have screen resolution
Please give me the clicks to that once you find it..  I need to have them on this box for future use
System Display is how I got it.  DIdn't help, but I got it
but you were able to set to generic lcd and restarted x
No option to select CRT or LCD anywhere, just resolution and frequency
I will be back in a bit, I need to find one of my Hardy boxes.
